label: A2B3C12_tP34_113_e_ae_2e2f-001
title: $\beta$-Gd$_{2}$(MoO$_{4}$)$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
Gd$_{2}$Mo$_{3}$O$_{12}$ takes on several different forms with changing temperature (Yuan, 2001): \begin{itemize} \item below 159$^\circ$C it is in the orthorhombic ground state \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C12_oP68_32_2c_3c_12c-001}{$\beta$'-Gd$_{2}$(MoO$_{4}$)$_{3}$} structure. \item In the range 159-850$^\circ$C it is in the monoclinic \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C12_mC68_15_f_ef_6f-001}{$\alpha$-Gd$_{2}$(MoO$_{4}$)$_{3}$} structure. \item Above 850$^\circ$C it is in the tetragonal \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B3C12_tP34_113_e_ae_2e2f-001}{$\beta$-Gd$_{2}$(MoO$_{4}$)$_{3}$} structure. (Shown here) \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-0.25in} 
 The ICSD entry for (Jeitschko, 1972) gives the structural information in the $C\overline{4}m2_{1}$ setting of space group \#113 rather than the standard $P\overline{4}2_{1}m$ setting. This doubled unit cell is nearly cubic. If $\mathbf{a}_{1}$, $\mathbf{a}_{2}$, and $\mathbf_{3}$ are the primitive vectors of $P\overline{4}2_{1}m$ cell, then the primitive vectors of the $C\overline{4}m2_{1}$ cell are: 
 $\begin{array}{ccc} \mathbf{a}_{1}' & = & \mathbf{a}_{1} - \mathbf{a}_{2} \\ \mathbf{a}_{2}' & = & \mathbf{a}_{1} + \mathbf{a}_{2} \\ \mathbf{a}_{3}' & = & \mathbf{a}_{3} \end{array}$. 
 The data was taken at 183$^\circ$C.  If the phase diagram from (Yaun, 2001) is correct, $\beta$-Gd$_{2}$(MoO$_{4}$)$_{3}$ is metastable at this temperature. (Jeitschko, 1972) only gives data for the $\beta$ and $\beta$' phases.
